#summary button widget reference

= button widget =
A [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkButton.html GtkButton] containing either a [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkLabel.html GtkLabel], a [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkImage.html GtkImage] or both packed inside a [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkHBox.html GtkHbox]
----

== Definition ==
{{{
<button yes no ok cancel help tag_attr="value"...>
	<label>string</label>
	<variable>varname</variable>
	<height>value</height>
	<width>value</width>
	<input file icon="image"></input>
	<input file stock="gtk-image"></input>
	<input file>filename</input>
	<visible>state</visible>
	<action>activity</action>...
	<action signal="event">activity</action>...
	<action type="function">parameter</action>...
</button>
}}}
"..." denotes acceptance of multiples of the same thing.

== Tag Attributes ==
See the [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkButton.html#GtkButton.object-hierarchy GtkButton] widget and ancestor class properties.

The following custom tag attributes are available:
None.

== Directives ==
Some of these may have tag attribute equivalents.
|| *Name* || *Description* || *Contents* || *Mandatory* || *Version* ||
|| label || Button text || || || ||
|| variable || Shell variable name || || || ||
|| height || Image scaling dimension || Positive integer, {{{-1}}} to ignore || || 0.7.21 ||
|| width || Image scaling dimension || Positive integer, {{{-1}}} to ignore || || 0.7.21 ||
|| input file icon="_image_" || GTK theme image name || || || ||
|| input file stock="_gtk-image_" || Stock GTK image name || {{{gtk-about}}}, {{{gtk-add}}}, ... [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/gtk-Stock-Items.html#GTK-STOCK-ABOUT:CAPS (full list)] || || ||
|| input file || Data input source || Image filename || || ||
|| visible || Sensitive state || {{{enabled}}} or {{{disabled}}} || || ||
|| action || Execute command on click || Shell command || || ||
|| action || Perform function on click || _function_:_parameter_ || || ||
|| action signal="_event_" || Execute command on event || Shell command || || ||
|| action signal="_event_" || Perform function on event || _function_:_parameter_ || || ||
|| action type="_function_" || Perform function on click || _parameter_ || || ||
